alert.note: Alert for Humboldt (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 6:34PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Nevada, including the following county, Humboldt. * WHEN...Until 930 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 627 PM PDT, gauge reports on Martin Creek indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of East Central Humboldt County, just east of the city of Paradise Valley. Runoff is impacting Martin Creek and Adams Slough. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
